text: The law of nations is naturally founded on this principle, that different nations ought in time of peace to do one another all the good they can, and in time of war as little injury as possible, without prejudicing their real interests.
author: Charles de Secondat

text: Peace congresses often start by dealing with some of the less important questions in excessive detail, so at the end there is no time to discuss the most important problems.
author: Fredrik Bajer

text: I love Christmas. Frosty the Snowman, peace on Earth and mangers, Salvation Army bell ringers and reindeer, the movie 'Meet Me in St. Louis,' office parties and cookies.
author: Mo Rocca

text: I'm at peace with my family, my friends, myself and God so there's really nothing else that I worry about.
author: Lance Bass
